page.title: 07LOCAL INDUSTRY 1
page.content: {UNIGATE DAIRY, EFFINGHAM} Although only a small depot it handles{67000 pints}weekly.The manager was sent there by Unigate 13 years ago.The{number of staff}was 23 now it is{19}.Milk consumption has gone down considerably as young children now prefer fizzy pop.Another reason for its decline is that the government has cut the third of a pint at schools.The manager said that although the distribution depot has changed the actual village has not.At first the milkman only used to take out milk on his float but now he sells potatoes, fruit juice,bread and cream etc.Their rounds stretch to Ranmore,Fetcham and Clandon.The milkmen arrive for work at 5am and finish at 1pm.When the floats return to the depot they are recharged for 6_7 hours as the floats run on electricity.
